comments:
We're going to lauch Help System from CD with the following script:
@echo off
if "%temp%" == "" .\jre\bin\java -classpath 
eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.help.base_3.0.1\helpbase.jar 
org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -eclipsehome eclipse -plugincustomization 
plugins\com.ibm.help.hs.doc\plugin_customization.ini -command displayHelp -
host 127.0.0.1 -noexec -data %tmp%\standalone
if not "%temp%" == "" .\jre\bin\java -classpath 
eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.help.base_3.0.1\helpbase.jar 
org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -eclipsehome eclipse -plugincustomization 
plugins\com.ibm.help.hs.doc\plugin_customization.ini -command displayHelp -
host 127.0.0.1 -noexec -data %temp%\standalone

When we runs the script from an existing dos window the command prompt returns 
with no output.  The Help System doesn't load. We got some error message in 
the log file:

!SESSION Nov 01, 2005 13:52:06.625 --------------------------------------------
-
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM Windows 32 build cn142ifx-20041203 
(142SR1+80507) (JIT enabled: jitc)
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -application org.eclipse.help.base.helpApplication -
plugincustomization plugins\com.ibm.cics.ts.doc\plugin_customization.ini

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Nov 01, 2005 13:52:06.625
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.RuntimeException: 
Application "org.eclipse.help.base.helpApplication" could not be found in the 
registry. The applications available are: <NONE>.
